messages.message:
Hey, I have an objection from the ANZ security and architecture teams on external API integrations. The discussion is around calling APIs inside things like validation functions. Does our new secrets feature help with this in any way?

_"What controls do we have in place to control user's ability to set up these external connections? What is stopping someone from passing document data outside Instabase or from pulling in something harmful from an external connection?"_

_cc @hannah_ _@Michael_ _@Kaustubh (KD)_ _@Jessica_

I'm imagining that projects/apps have to get approval from an admin for the approved API uses. The API uses could be linked to secrets so you know which corresponds to which.

We'd need to enforce secrets use for all API calls for that

This is really a question of trusting your developers. Anyone who develops an advanced app and uses a UDF can use it to perform any arbitrary function. Limit development to workspaces that can be validated by some trusted validation process.
